_header: Lo by the sentence of prudent Solomon
Subjects: occasional verse; pageant verses; chronicles, verse in; Henry VI, return to London, 1432
_description: Pageant verses by Cleanness at the return of Henry VI to London, A.D. 1432, in Fabyan’s Chronicle, Part VII, Septima Pars, Henrici Sexti — two stanzas of rhyme royal

HarEng766.First Lines:
Loo by the Sentence of prudent SalamonMercy and Right preservyn
                    euery kyngAnd I Clennesse obserued by ReasonKepe his Trone from
                    Mischief and falling…
HarEng766.Last Lines:
…That kynges and prynces shuld abowte them draweffolk that
                    been trewe and Well lernyd In lawe
